meanings.definition: The branch of psychology that deals with the relationships between physical stimuli and mental phenomena.
meanings.sent1: Psychophysics helps us understand how our minds perceive the world around us.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in psychophysics investigate how our senses interact with external stimuli.
meanings.sent3: Studying psychophysics can be like solving a puzzle between our senses and the outside world.
meanings.sent4: The field of psychophysics unveils the hidden connections between our perceptions and the physical world.
meanings.sent5: Through psychophysics, we unravel the mysteries of how our brains interpret the signals from our environment.

meanings.definition: The study of the relationship between physical stimuli and the sensations and perceptions they affect.
meanings.sent1: Understanding psychophysics helps us grasp how our senses react to different stimuli.
meanings.sent2: Psychophysics explores how our perceptions are influenced by external factors.
meanings.sent3: Learning about psychophysics can be like discovering the secret language of our senses.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of psychophysics, we decode the messages our senses receive from the world.
meanings.sent5: The study of psychophysics sheds light on the intricate dance between our sensations and the stimuli they encounter.
